page.title: 14Clubs <continued>
page.content: branch,the group leader being Mrs.M Calmen. meetings are held monthly in Criftins Parish Hall, and there is an average attendance of around twenty. Meetings are opened by a short service from the M.U. prayer book, then followed by a talk or discussion on any, subjects such as generation gap -divorce-the work of the Mother's Union overseas e.t.c. Each year money is raised and sent to help the work of the Mother's Union overseas. The meeting this month will be a strawberry tea at the home of Mrs.Ward- Smith,the money raised will be sent to help this work. In June members went by coach to visit Melverley church, which is building of framed timber.A very interesting church which dates back to Henry the fourth.
